qas.question: What 19th century author associated his works with humanism?
When was the first public group for Humanist founded?
When did Charles Potter and Clara Potter publish their first writings on Humanism?
What 15th century author associated his works with humanism?
When was the worst public group for Humanists founded?
Who destroyed the First Humanist Society of New York?
When did Charles Potter and Clara Potter hide their first writings on Humanism?
Who burned every copy of the book Humanism: A New Religion?

context: Active in the early 1920s, <a0_0><b4_0>F.C.S. Schiller<b4_0/><a0_0/> labelled his work "humanism" but for Schiller the term referred to the pragmatist philosophy he shared with William James. In <a1_0><b5_0>1929<b5_0/><a1_0/>, <a2_0><b6_0>Charles Francis Potter<b6_0/><a2_0/> founded the First Humanist Society of New York whose advisory board included Julian Huxley, John Dewey, Albert Einstein and Thomas Mann. Potter was a minister from the Unitarian tradition and in <a3_0><b7_0>1930<b7_0/><a3_0/> he and his wife, <b8_0>Clara Cook Potter<b8_0/>, published Humanism: A New Religion. Throughout the 1930s, Potter was an advocate of such liberal causes as, women’s rights, access to birth control, "civil divorce laws", and an end to capital punishment.
